issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Race condition in MiniMRYarnCluster when getting history server address

comments.body: Uploaded a patch

Thanks [~jianhe] for the work. I have one quick w.r.t the atomic boolean in the patch. If we're just using atomic read/write for the boolean flag, I think a volatile boolean would suffice. We're not actually using the "fancy" features of atomic boolean in this fix. The other part of the patch LGTM.

This message was automatically generated.
[~gtCarrera9], thanks for taking a look at this. This variable needs to be declared as final since it's accessed from within an inner class. So a boolean flag may not work as it cannot be reset ?
Oh I overlooked that. Yes in this case we can use an atomic boolean. +1 for the patch.

Well wait, quick question---why do we need to initialize a customized job history server here? I think we can directly set the flag in the thread's run() method, after the historyServer.start() is done? Then we can wait on the flag afterwards?
thanks Li for reviewing , updated the patch accordingly.
Latest change LGTM. Could any committers please review this change? Thanks!
+1 lgtm. Will commit the patch after Jenkins says OK
